Julie McCabe wrote:

> Hello,
> 
> Summary: Can a parameter be passed into a TestSuite?
> 
> 
> Background: I would like to use Junit to unit test grid services, that is I
> would like the service to be running.  I intend to create a subclass of the
> TestCase class for each service and create methods to unit test the
> appropriate methods.  I would like to call all the tests by creating a
> TestSuite which has access to the service endpoint (URI/location) to class
> name mappings which then creates TestSuites for all those classes eg
>      
>       someTestSuite.addTest(GridServiceTestClass.suite())
> 
> The TestSuite which should auto pick up all the Tests needs a parameter 
> to be
> passed in to indicate the service endpoint.  Is this possible?

Yes, but not directly.

> At a guess, I could set a static variable with the endpoint in the class
> creating the TestSuite and reference that within the TestSuite - any 
> ideas on
> this?  

Your test will have to grab that data from somewhere, and there are a 
number of useful "somewheres":

1. a properties file
2. a JVM (system) property
3. your own configuration file
4. a database
[...]

Unfortunately, xUnit does not directly support passing fixture data into 
a test from the outside. Instead, the test has to grab its fixture data 
from the outside world. Patterns such as Parameterized Test Case (See 
/JUnit Recipes/, recipe 4.8) try to get around this limitation, but 
their use is somewhat limited.

> I could be taking the wrong approach to this - so ideas greatly welcomed.

Any of the above ideas work for you?
